bill_title: limit certain outside employment and compensation by presidents and executive officers of state institutions of higher education.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to limit certain outside employment and compensation by presidents and executive officers of state institutions of higher education. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. No person serving as president or other executive officer of any institution of higher education under the jurisdiction or control of the Board of Regents, who is receiving annual compensation from the institution in excess of one hundred thousand dollars, may accept any form of employment with, or discharge any services or duties for, any corporate business enterprise for any form of salary, financial incentive, or any other valuable consideration unless the aggregate annual compensation from such outside employment is less than ten thousand dollars and does not substantially interfere with the diligent performance of his or her primary duties. 180 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.052 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
